TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EditorAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the editor to use to change a property. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When editing the property, a visual designer should create a new instance of the specified editor through a dialog box or drop-down window.
Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute.EditorBaseTypeName%2A> property to find this editor's base type. The only available base type is <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor>.
Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute.EditorTypeName%2A> property to get the name of the type of editor associated with this attribute.
For general information on using attributes. see [Attributes](../Topic/Extending%20Metadata%20Using%20Attributes.md). For more information on design-time attributes, see [Attributes and Design-Time Support](../Topic/Attributes%20and%20Design-Time%20Support.md).
## Examples The following code example creates the `MyImage` class. The class is marked with an EditorAttribute that specifies the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ImageEditor> as its editor.
[!code-cs[Classic EditorAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.componentmodel._81_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic EditorAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.componentmodel._81_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic EditorAttribute Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.componentmodel._81_1.vb)]
The following code example creates an instance of the `MyImage` class, gets the attributes for the class, and then prints the name of the editor used by `myNewImage`.
[!code-cs[Classic EditorAttribute Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.componentmodel._81_2.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic EditorAttribute Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/CPP/t-system.componentmodel._81_2.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic EditorAttribute Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.componentmodel._81_2.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default editor, which is no editor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string typeName, string baseTypeName) cil managed

Docs.param: The fully qualified type name of the editor.
The fully qualified type name of the base class or interface to use as a lookup key for the editor. This class must be or derive from .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the type name and base type name of the editor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `typeName` parameter must be in the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> format.
The <xref:System.Type> represented by the `typeName` parameter must either derive from or implement the base class.
The <xref:System.Type> represented by the `baseTypeName` parameter is used as a key to find a particular editor, because a data type can have more than one editor associated with it. This can be any class, but is typically <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string typeName, class System.Type baseType) cil managed

Docs.param: The fully qualified type name of the editor.
The <xref:System.Type> of the base class or interface to use as a lookup key for the editor. This class must be or derive from .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the type name and the base type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `typeName` parameter must be in the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> format.
The <xref:System.Type> represented by the `typeName` must either derive from or implement the base class.
The `baseType` parameter is used as a key to find a particular editor, because a data type can have more than one editor associated with it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type, class System.Type baseType) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.Type> that represents the type of the editor.
The <xref:System.Type> of the base class or interface to use as a lookup key for the editor. This class must be or derive from .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the type and the base type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Type> represented by the `type` parameter must either derive from or implement the base class.
The `baseType` parameter is used as a key to find a particular editor, because a data type can have more than one editor associated with it.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the base class or interface serving as a lookup key for this editor.
Docs.value: The name of the base class or interface serving as a lookup key for this editor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The EditorBaseTypeName property is an assembly qualified type name. The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] provides both <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor> as valid base classes, but any value is valid here.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the editor class in the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> format.
Docs.value: The name of the editor class in the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> format.

Docs.param: The object to test the value equality of.
Docs.summary: Returns whether the value of the given object is equal to the current .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
Gets a unique ID for this attribute type.
Docs.value: A unique ID for this attribute type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TypeId property is used by filtering algorithms to identify two attributes that are the same type. For most attributes, this just returns the <xref:System.Type> instance for the attribute. <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> overrides this to include the type of the editor base type.
